pull.title: Bugfix: RPC/Wallet: Make BTC/kB and sat/B fee modes work sanely
pull.body:
Expects `fee_mode` for explicit feerate modes instead of overloading `conf_target` (positional args still accept either for now; that can be restricted once we finally have #17356).

`fundrawtransaction` used to expect its option to be called `feeRate`, diverging from other `fee_rate` option names. It now accepts either, with `feeRate` soft-deprecated.

`fundrawtransaction` and `bumpfee` still accept `fee_rate` without `estimate_mode` for backward compatibility.

Borrows tests from #20220 (adapted for interface changes). (NOTE: *NOT* including 9ea6d390c26975c98a9cf28cf816bcbded9aa3d1 77a4f98897ab4430311cff3f2226f274fad20d6a f97a3cd3e6e229305a4451d611d77cbf3892381f)

events.message:
RPC/Wallet: Move nonzero feerate check to SetFeeEstimateMode

Was only in bumpfee's helper
RPC/Wallet: sendtoaddress & sendmany: Accept fee_rate as an alternative to conf_target

events.body: @jonatack  What do you think of this approach? (Actually what I thought it already was!)

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20220 (wallet, rpc: explicit fee rate follow-ups/fixes for 0.21 by jonatack)
* #17211 (Allow fundrawtransaction and walletcreatefundedpsbt to take external inputs by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

I agree this is more sane than currently, especially aliasing `feeRate` to `fee_rate`. Didn't test the commit "RPC/Wallet: sendtoaddress & sendmany: Accept fee_rate as an alternatve to conf_target"; not sure it works as-is but it would need test coverage.

events.message:
Bugfix: RPC/Wallet: Pass both conf_target and fee_rate into SetFeeEstimateMode separately to replace broken code duplication

For compatibility, bumpfee and fundraw accept fee_rate without estimate_mode
RPC/Wallet: Deprecate fundrawtransaction feeRate and replace with fee_rate
Bugfix: RPC/Wallet: Fix help for "send" method
QA: Test bumpfee RPC with BTC/kB and sat/B estimation modes
wallet: add bumpfee feerate coverage, improve error/help
test: refactor rpc_psbt.py for walletcreatefundedpsbt feerate coverage
QA: wallet_basic: Adapt sendtoaddress/sendmany tests to use fee_rate named param

events.body: Fixed review comments including adapting tests
Concept/approach ACK, also superficial code review ACK. Needs linter fix.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
 This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>

comments.body: It could maybe just be removed. The tests I added in #20220 for the other 5 RPCs check that the code detects this and raises with `"Fee rate (0.00000000 BTC/kB) is lower than the minimum fee rate setting (0.00001000 BTC/kB)`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4024,9 +4024,10 @@ static RPCHelpMan send()
                     {"change_address", RPCArg::Type::STR_HEX, /* default */ "pool address", "The bitcoin address to receive the change"},
                     {"change_position", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "random", "The index of the change output"},
                     {"change_type", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "set by -changetype", "The output type to use. Only valid if change_address is not specified. Options are \"legacy\", \"p2sh-segwit\", and \"bech32\"."},
-                    {"conf_target", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "wallet default", "Confirmation target (in blocks), or fee rate (for " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB or " + CURRENCY_ATOM + "/B estimate modes)"},
+                    {"conf_target", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "wallet default", "Confirmation target (in blocks)"},
                     {"estimate_mode", RPCArg::Type::STR, /* default */ "unset", std::string() + "The fee estimate mode, must be one of (case insensitive):\n"
             "       \"" + FeeModes("\"\n\"") + "\""},
+                    {"fee_rate", RPCArg::Type::NUM, /* default */ "wallet default", "Fee rate (for " + CURRENCY_UNIT + "/kB or " + CURRENCY_ATOM + "/B estimate modes)"},
comments.body: eeae8bbf7785133f0df3c7b731a452204eb03b15 I don't think this works at this commit? Maybe as `feeRate` but then you see `Cannot specify both estimate_mode and feeRate`. Also, `wallet_send.py` has no test coverage for it currently.
Concept ACK on moving away from `feeRate`
IMO these are fundamentally different error types, and should probably be handled differently.

comments.body: I had to look this up as this is comparing pointers to unrelated objects, but my reading of https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/language/operator_comparison is that this is indeed well defined.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -440,7 +451,7 @@ static RPCHelpMan sendtoaddress()
                     {"subtractfeefromamount", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "false", "The fee will be deducted from the amount being sent.\n"
                                          "The recipient will receive less bitcoins than you enter in the amount field."},
                     {"replaceable", RPCArg::Type::BOOL, /* default */ "wallet default", "Allow this transaction to be replaced by a transaction with higher fees via BIP 125"},

comments.body: should this also be aliased to something? Like `fee_rate_type`?
